name: Czech Inn Hostel

reviews.text: We were very happy with the Czech Inn. We were definitely not expecting such a nice hostel, after coming from Berlin and staying in a not-so-nice hostel.
reviews.title: Nice surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Czech Inn was cheap, it was also clean, the bathrooms were REALLY nice (almost like a 4 star hotel), the service was great, the rooms were big, the beds comfortable, the breakfast was good and worth the price, but the location was sort of far from the center of town. It didn't really matter to us, but we had a hard time trying to find it when we first arrived.
reviews.title: Good value unless you can put up with thin walls.

reviews.text: if I'm ever in Prague again, I would stay here in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: If you want to be comfortable, Czech-Inn is perfect

reviews.text: The hostel is located a bit out of the way from the main city/cbd however, there are trams that goes past the hostel. You can walk from the hostel to the main square/boulevard (Wenceslas Square) in 20-25mins. My wife and I done it twice in the middle of winter.
reviews.title: Great place to stay with a very good price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist was good and helpful. There's an internet cafe and an ATM located in the reception area.
reviews.title: In depth description for young couples
Not your typical hostel-High level of service, spacious contemporary rooms, and great bar/restaurant within the hostel
reviews.text: This is not your typical hostel. It does not feel like a hostel but more like a more expensive hotel or bed and breakfast. The staff is very accomodating and helpful with city information. The rooms are exquisitely designed and very comfortable. It is impeccably clean and has a feeling of freshness. While many would associate hostels with youth travelers, as a 40 ear-old traveler it was a very comfortable stay. The bar/cafe has 6 beers on tap and this is quite the exception for bars in Czech. Normally one only finds 2 choices and in many cases only one local brew is the offering. There are computers available with internet access for a very modest fee. Wi-fi is free for those with their own electronic devices. I would recommend the Czech Inn to all who are looking for an upscale stay, even if you are on a tight budget as the cost is well within the range of travelers with a frugal mind. Even if cost is no issue, this place is definitely worth staying. We look foward to returning soon!
Great place, really enjoyed my stay clean and comfortable not really a traditional backpackers place but for those who want good clean trendy afordable accomodation it is ideal
reviews.title: Brand New great service very clean

reviews.text: we are group of 5 ppl booked a 3-bedroom apartment. It turn out they offer us two 2-bedroom apartment on the top floor which are connected throught the roof. The apartment are awsome! They are large, clean and with modern design. The only bad side is no TV. but what do u expect in a hostel?! Staffs are helpful. Cheap internet connection with the desktop provided in the lobby. They offer cheap internetional phone call at the counter as well! Overall... Its excellent!!! Best value, Best service, Best room!
reviews.title: Best ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Czech Inn felt more like a trendy converted warehouse or a contemporary art gallery than a hostel - except that it was actually an older building and had retained some of its heritage features.
reviews.title: Minimalist but cosy - a great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in a double ensuite room, called the "extra special grand royal suite". The furniture was minimalist, as you'd expect from a hostel (no TV), but the bed was ultra comfy, we had big windows looking out into the street, and our bathroom was ultra modern with automatic lights and polished concrete. Loved the look and feel of the place, everything was spotless.
reviews.title: Fun, comfortable accommodation -perfect for older adults on a budget!

reviews.text: I stayed here from November 25-28 and had an absolutely wonderful experience. I stayed in room 406 which was STUNNING - very large, plenty of space to store my belongings, a gorgeous bathroom, and a beautiful view of the area! The breakfast every morning was delicious and lots of - eggs, bread, fruit, cereal, coffee, tea, et al. The staff were also very helpful - in particular Lauren at the front desk, who was a joy! I would recommend this place to any traveler - can't recommend it enough!
reviews.title: LOVED the Czech Inn!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Czech Inn is like no other hostel I have ever stayed in.
reviews.title: WOW!!!
Very Clean, Great Hostel
reviews.text: Cons: Location not central. But this is my 3rd time to Prague and it was easier to get to than the other places I have stayed.

reviews.title: Cool Hostel!
reviews.text: Pros: EVERYTHING! From the moment you check in the staff are so helpful. Not friendly and fun but very very professional. The rooms are stunning. After 7 weeks backpacking it felt like it was 5 star! The bed was the most comfortable on the trip. The room was large and bright and beautifully decorated - very contemporary. The bathrooms (although shared) were fantastic. The best shower of the trip. We are actually trying to find similar showerheads for our shower back home! The bar downstairs was cute and when were we there they had a comedian performing (not that funny but still a fun night). They aren't skilled in cocktail making but pull a good beer. Food can be ordered and is actually brought in from a neighbouring restuarant.

Stay here stay here stay here. It is slightly more expensive for a hostel but worth every penny. Make sure you read their instructions on the website on how to get there. We did and found it easy enough.
reviews.title: Nice Hostel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Czech Inn during a 7 week trip through parts of Europe and Africa. When we arrived in Prague, it was rainy and overcast. There was a definite vibe to the city that we were enjoying. The Czech inn furthered this impression with its low lighting and granite bathrooms. We stayed in one of the loft apartments that had a kitchen and private bathroom. It was gigantic. Not a ton of furniture, but way nicer than any other hostel I've stayed in before. It felt much more like a hotel than a hostel. The location isn't the most central you can get, but it's just a short walk to catch the tram, which takes you to the metro. After that, it's pretty easy to get around. They also have a luggage storage room if you need to store your stuff for a while before checking out.
reviews.title: Great Value, Great Atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Loved the bar in the lobby of the hostel. There was a little dog that ran around in it, good music, and good specials on Czech beer. The only complaint I had was with the front desk staff. They were hopelessly slow, both with check in and check out. We waited in long lines with lots of other grumpy people. However, it wouldn't be enough to deter me from coming back. For the money, you really can't beat it.
reviews.title: Stylish and great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Czech Inn during a long weekend break in Prague and were thoroughly impressed. The hostel is stylishly decorated and feels like a boutique hotel. We stayed in a double room which didn't have an en-suite, but was right next to a bathroom with a wonderful power shower. The location is out of the centre, but it is incredibly easy to get into town via the metro or trams- the trams stop right outside the hostel; the nearest tube is a 5-10 min walk. We loved Prague and the Czech Inn was the perfect place to stay.
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed in the Czech Inn for 4 nights in our own double room with ensuite. The room was very clean and huge! The staff were really helpful with tips of what to see in Prague and with getting around the city.
reviews.title: Clean, modern hostel

reviews.text: Breakfast was delicious, although started a bit late at 8.30am. This would be my only complaint.
reviews.title: stylish location

description: Yes, you can afford to sleep in style and comfort! Czech Inn is a new hybrid of hotel and hostel – truly offering something for everyone – and blending the comfort of a hotel and the social vibe of a hostel. The modern design and ultra-comfortable furnishings have created quite a stir in many publications such as The New York Times, The Guardian, The Washington Post, Hotel Design, Lonely Planet, Let's Go, Elle Magazine…
